dt: {bc}any of various devices for producing light or sometimes heat: such as
{bc}a vessel with a wick for burning an inflammable liquid (such as oil) to produce light
{bc}a glass bulb or tube that emits light produced by electricity (such as an incandescent light bulb or fluorescent lamp)
{bc}a decorative appliance housing a lamp that is usually covered by a shade
{bc}a source of intellectual or spiritual illumination

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}lampe{/it}, from Latin {it}lampas{/it}, from Greek, from {it}lampein{/it} to shine; akin to Hittite {it}lap-{/it} to burn
shortdef: any of various devices for producing light or sometimes heat: such as
a vessel with a wick for burning an inflammable liquid (such as oil) to produce light
a glass bulb or tube that emits light produced by electricity (such as an incandescent light bulb or fluorescent lamp)

dt: {bc}an electric lamp that produces light by an arc made when a current passes between two incandescent electrodes surrounded by gas

shortdef: an electric lamp that produces light by an arc made when a current passes between two incandescent electrodes surrounded by gas —called also arc light

dt: {bc}an electric lamp in which an enclosed gas or vapor glows or causes a phosphor coating on the lamp's inner surface to glow

shortdef: an electric lamp in which an enclosed gas or vapor glows or causes a phosphor coating on the lamp's inner surface to glow

dt: {bc}a tall lamp that stands on the floor

shortdef: a tall lamp that stands on the floor

dt: {bc}a usually tubular electric lamp having a coating of fluorescent material on its inner surface and containing mercury vapor whose bombardment by electrons from the cathode provides ultraviolet light which causes the material to emit visible light

shortdef: a usually tubular electric lamp having a coating of fluorescent material on its inner surface and containing mercury vapor whose bombardment by electrons from the cathode provides ultraviolet light which causes the material to emit visible light

dt: {bc}a gas-discharge electric lamp in which most of the light proceeds from the glow of the gas near the cathode

shortdef: a gas-discharge electric lamp in which most of the light proceeds from the glow of the gas near the cathode

art.capt: incandescent lamp: {it}1{/it} bulb containing gas, {it}2{/it} filament, {it}3{/it} connecting and supporting wires, {it}4{/it} exhaust tube, {it}5{/it} screw base, {it}6{/it} base contact

dt: {bc}a decorative lamp constructed of a transparent glass container filled with liquid and wax that is heated by an incandescent bulb which melts the wax and causes it to form random moving shapes within the liquid

dt.t: {wi}Lava lamps{/wi} are back—and not just among retro hipsters lounging on shag rugs and waterbeds.
The {wi}lava lamp{/wi} on my son's bureau gives him a vantage point to ponder the colorful blobs rising and falling as their temperature and density change.

shortdef: a decorative lamp constructed of a transparent glass container filled with liquid and wax that is heated by an incandescent bulb which melts the wax and causes it to form random moving shapes within the liquid

dt: {bc}an electric lamp in which the discharge takes place through mercury vapor

shortdef: an electric lamp in which the discharge takes place through mercury vapor —called also mercury lamp

dt: {bc}a light bulb consisting of a quartz bulb and a tungsten filament with the bulb containing iodine which reacts with the vaporized tungsten to prevent excessive blackening of the bulb

shortdef: a light bulb consisting of a quartz bulb and a tungsten filament with the bulb containing iodine which reacts with the vaporized tungsten to prevent excessive blackening of the bulb
